00041 /**
00042  * @file
00043  *
00044  * Interface to the hardware Fetch and Add Unit.
00045  *
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __CVMX_HWFAU_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_HWFAU_H__
00050 
00051 typedef int cvmx_fau_reg64_t;
00052 typedef int cvmx_fau_reg32_t;
00053 typedef int cvmx_fau_reg16_t;
00054 typedef int cvmx_fau_reg8_t;
00055 
00056 #define CVMX_FAU_REG_ANY    -1
00057 
00058 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00059 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00060 extern "C" {
00061 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 /*
00065  * Octeon Fetch and Add Unit (FAU)
00066  */
00067 
00068 #define CVMX_FAU_LOAD_IO_ADDRESS    cvmx_build_io_address(0x1e, 0)
00069 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_SCRADDR       63,56
00070 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_LEN           55,48
00071 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_INEVAL        35,14
00072 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_TAGWAIT       13,13
00073 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_NOADD         13,13
00074 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_SIZE          12,11
00075 #define CVMX_FAU_BITS_REGISTER      10,0
00076 
00077 #define CVMX_FAU_MAX_REGISTERS_8  (2048)
00078 
00079 typedef enum {
00080     CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_8 = 0,
00081     CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_16 = 1,
00082     CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_32 = 2,
00083     CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_64 = 3
00084 } cvmx_fau_op_size_t;
00085 
00086 /**
00087  * Tagwait return definition. If a timeout occurs, the error
00088  * bit will be set. Otherwise the value of the register before
00089  * the update will be returned.
00090  */
00091 typedef struct {
00092     uint64_t error:1;
00093     int64_t value:63;
00094 } cvmx_fau_tagwait64_t;
00095 
00096 /**
00097  * Tagwait return definition. If a timeout occurs, the error
00098  * bit will be set. Otherwise the value of the register before
00099  * the update will be returned.
00100  */
00101 typedef struct {
00102     uint64_t error:1;
00103     int32_t value:31;
00104 } cvmx_fau_tagwait32_t;
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * Tagwait return definition. If a timeout occurs, the error
00108  * bit will be set. Otherwise the value of the register before
00109  * the update will be returned.
00110  */
00111 typedef struct {
00112     uint64_t error:1;
00113     int16_t value:15;
00114 } cvmx_fau_tagwait16_t;
00115 
00116 /**
00117  * Tagwait return definition. If a timeout occurs, the error
00118  * bit will be set. Otherwise the value of the register before
00119  * the update will be returned.
00120  */
00121 typedef struct {
00122     uint64_t error:1;
00123     int8_t value:7;
00124 } cvmx_fau_tagwait8_t;
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * Asynchronous tagwait return definition. If a timeout occurs,
00128  * the error bit will be set. Otherwise the value of the
00129  * register before the update will be returned.
00130  */
00131 typedef union {
00132     uint64_t u64;
00133     struct {
00134         uint64_t invalid:1;
00135         uint64_t data:63;   /* unpredictable if invalid is set */
00136     } s;
00137 } cvmx_fau_async_tagwait_result_t;
00138 
00139 #ifdef __LITTLE_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00140 #define SWIZZLE_8  0x7
00141 #define SWIZZLE_16 0x6
00142 #define SWIZZLE_32 0x4
00143 #else
00144 #define SWIZZLE_8  0
00145 #define SWIZZLE_16 0
00146 #define SWIZZLE_32 0
00147 #endif
00148 
00149 /**
00150  * @INTERNAL
00151  * Builds a store I/O address for writing to the FAU
00152  *
00153  * @param noadd  0 = Store value is atomically added to the current value
00154  *               1 = Store value is atomically written over the current value
00155  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00156  *               - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00157  *               - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00158  *               - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00159  * @return Address to store for atomic update
00160  */
00161 static inline uint64_t __cvmx_hwfau_store_address(uint64_t noadd, uint64_t reg)
00162 {
00163     return (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(CVMX_FAU_LOAD_IO_ADDRESS) |
00164         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_NOADD, noadd) |
00165         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_REGISTER, reg));
00166 }
00167 
00168 /**
00169  * @INTERNAL
00170  * Builds a I/O address for accessing the FAU
00171  *
00172  * @param tagwait Should the atomic add wait for the current tag switch
00173  *                operation to complete.
00174  *                - 0 = Don't wait
00175  *                - 1 = Wait for tag switch to complete
00176  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00177  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00178  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00179  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00180  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00181  *                Note: When performing 32 and 64 bit access, only the low
00182  *                22 bits are available.
00183  * @return Address to read from for atomic update
00184  */ static inline uint64_t __cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(uint64_t tagwait, uint64_t reg, int64_t value)
00185 {
00186     return (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(CVMX_FAU_LOAD_IO_ADDRESS) |
00187         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_INEVAL, value) |
00188         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_TAGWAIT, tagwait) |
00189         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_REGISTER, reg));
00190 }
00191 
00192 /**
00193  * Perform an atomic 64 bit add
00194  *
00195  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00196  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00197  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00198  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00199  * @return Value of the register before the update
00200  */
00201 static inline int64_t cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00202 {
00203     return cvmx_read64_int64(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(0, reg, value));
00204 }
00205 
00206 /**
00207  * Perform an atomic 32 bit add
00208  *
00209  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00210  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00211  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00212  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00213  * @return Value of the register before the update
00214  */
00215 static inline int32_t cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00216 {
00217     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00218     return cvmx_read64_int32(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(0, reg, value));
00219 }
00220 
00221 /**
00222  * Perform an atomic 16 bit add
00223  *
00224  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00225  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00226  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00227  * @return Value of the register before the update
00228  */
00229 static inline int16_t cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00230 {
00231     reg ^= SWIZZLE_16;
00232     return cvmx_read64_int16(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(0, reg, value));
00233 }
00234 
00235 /**
00236  * Perform an atomic 8 bit add
00237  *
00238  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00239  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00240  * @return Value of the register before the update
00241  */
00242 static inline int8_t cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00243 {
00244     reg ^= SWIZZLE_8;
00245     return cvmx_read64_int8(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(0, reg, value));
00246 }
00247 
00248 /**
00249  * Perform an atomic 64 bit add after the current tag switch
00250  * completes
00251  *
00252  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00253  *               - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00254  * @param value  Signed value to add.
00255  *               Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00256  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00257  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00258  *         returned
00259  */
00260 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait64_t cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00261 {
00262     union {
00263         uint64_t i64;
00264         cvmx_fau_tagwait64_t t;
00265     } result;
00266     result.i64 = cvmx_read64_int64(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(1, reg, value));
00267         
00268     return result.t;
00269 }
00270 
00271 /**
00272  * Perform an atomic 32 bit add after the current tag switch
00273  * completes
00274  *
00275  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00276  *               - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00277  * @param value  Signed value to add.
00278  *               Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00279  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00280  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00281  *         returned
00282  */
00283 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait32_t cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00284 {
00285     union {
00286         uint64_t i32;
00287         cvmx_fau_tagwait32_t t;
00288     } result;
00289     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00290     result.i32 = cvmx_read64_int32(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(1, reg, value));
00291     return result.t;
00292 }
00293 
00294 /**
00295  * Perform an atomic 16 bit add after the current tag switch
00296  * completes
00297  *
00298  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00299  *               - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00300  * @param value  Signed value to add.
00301  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00302  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00303  *         returned
00304  */
00305 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait16_t cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00306 {
00307     union {
00308         uint64_t i16;
00309         cvmx_fau_tagwait16_t t;
00310     } result;
00311     reg ^= SWIZZLE_16;
00312     result.i16 = cvmx_read64_int16(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(1, reg, value));
00313     return result.t;
00314 }
00315 
00316 /**
00317  * Perform an atomic 8 bit add after the current tag switch
00318  * completes
00319  *
00320  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00321  * @param value  Signed value to add.
00322  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00323  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00324  *         returned
00325  */
00326 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait8_t cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00327 {
00328     union {
00329         uint64_t i8;
00330         cvmx_fau_tagwait8_t t;
00331     } result;
00332     reg ^= SWIZZLE_8;
00333     result.i8 = cvmx_read64_int8(__cvmx_hwfau_atomic_address(1, reg, value));
00334     return result.t;
00335 }
00336 
00337 /**
00338  * @INTERNAL
00339  * Builds I/O data for async operations
00340  *
00341  * @param scraddr Scratch pad byte addres to write to.  Must be 8 byte aligned
00342  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00343  *                Note: When performing 32 and 64 bit access, only the low
00344  *                22 bits are available.
00345  * @param tagwait Should the atomic add wait for the current tag switch
00346  *                operation to complete.
00347  *                - 0 = Don't wait
00348  *                - 1 = Wait for tag switch to complete
00349  * @param size    The size of the operation:
00350  *                - CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_8  (0) = 8 bits
00351  *                - CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_16 (1) = 16 bits
00352  *                - CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_32 (2) = 32 bits
00353  *                - CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_64 (3) = 64 bits
00354  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00355  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00356  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00357  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00358  * @return Data to write using cvmx_send_single
00359  */
00360 static inline uint64_t __cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(uint64_t scraddr, int64_t value, uint64_t tagwait, cvmx_fau_op_size_t size, uint64_t reg)
00361 {
00362     return (CVMX_FAU_LOAD_IO_ADDRESS |
00363         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_SCRADDR, scraddr >> 3) |
00364         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_LEN, 1) |
00365         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_INEVAL, value) |
00366         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_TAGWAIT, tagwait) |
00367         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_SIZE, size) |
00368         cvmx_build_bits(CVMX_FAU_BITS_REGISTER, reg));
00369 }
00370 
00371 /**
00372  * Perform an async atomic 64 bit add. The old value is
00373  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00374  *
00375  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00376  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00377  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00378  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00379  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00380  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00381  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00382  */
00383 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add64(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00384 {
00385     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 0, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_64, reg));
00386 }
00387 
00388 /**
00389  * Perform an async atomic 32 bit add. The old value is
00390  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00391  *
00392  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00393  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00394  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00395  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00396  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00397  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00398  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00399  */
00400 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add32(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00401 {
00402     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 0, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_32, reg));
00403 }
00404 
00405 /**
00406  * Perform an async atomic 16 bit add. The old value is
00407  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00408  *
00409  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00410  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00411  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00412  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00413  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00414  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00415  */
00416 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add16(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00417 {
00418     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 0, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_16, reg));
00419 }
00420 
00421 /**
00422  * Perform an async atomic 8 bit add. The old value is
00423  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00424  *
00425  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00426  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00427  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00428  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00429  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00430  */
00431 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add8(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00432 {
00433     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 0, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_8, reg));
00434 }
00435 
00436 /**
00437  * Perform an async atomic 64 bit add after the current tag
00438  * switch completes.
00439  *
00440  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00441  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00442  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00443  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00444  *                returned
00445  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00446  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00447  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00448  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00449  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00450  */
00451 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add64(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00452 {
00453     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 1, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_64, reg));
00454 }
00455 
00456 /**
00457  * Perform an async atomic 32 bit add after the current tag
00458  * switch completes.
00459  *
00460  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00461  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00462  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00463  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00464  *                returned
00465  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00466  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00467  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00468  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00469  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00470  */
00471 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add32(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00472 {
00473     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 1, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_32, reg));
00474 }

00476 /**

00478  * switch completes.
00479  *
00480  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00481  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00482  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00483  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00484  *                returned
00485  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00486  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00487  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00488  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00489  */
00490 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add16(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00491 {

00495 /**
00496  * Perform an async atomic 8 bit add after the current tag
00497  * switch completes.
00498  *
00499  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00500  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00501  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00502  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00503  *                returned
00504  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00505  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00506  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00507  */
00508 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add8(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00509 {
00510     cvmx_send_single(__cvmx_fau_iobdma_data(scraddr, value, 1, CVMX_FAU_OP_SIZE_8, reg));
00511 }
00512 
00513 /**
00514  * Perform an atomic 64 bit add
00515  *
00516  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00517  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00518  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00519  */
00520 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00521 {
00522     cvmx_write64_int64(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(0, reg), value);
00523 }
00524 
00525 /**
00526  * Perform an atomic 32 bit add
00527  *
00528  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00529  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00530  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00531  */
00532 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00533 {
00534     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00535     cvmx_write64_int32(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(0, reg), value);
00536 }
00537 
00538 /**
00539  * Perform an atomic 16 bit add
00540  *
00541  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00542  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00543  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00544  */
00545 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00546 {
00547     reg ^= SWIZZLE_16;
00548     cvmx_write64_int16(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(0, reg), value);
00549 }
00550 
00551 /**
00552  * Perform an atomic 8 bit add
00553  *
00554  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00555  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00556  */
00557 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00558 {
00559     reg ^= SWIZZLE_8;
00560     cvmx_write64_int8(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(0, reg), value);
00561 }
00562 
00563 /**
00564  * Perform an atomic 64 bit write
00565  *
00566  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00567  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00568  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00569  */
00570 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00571 {
00572     cvmx_write64_int64(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(1, reg), value);
00573 }
00574 
00575 /**
00576  * Perform an atomic 32 bit write
00577  *
00578  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00579  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00580  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00581  */
00582 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00583 {
00584     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00585     cvmx_write64_int32(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(1, reg), value);
00586 }
00587 
00588 /**
00589  * Perform an atomic 16 bit write
00590  *
00591  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00592  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00593  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00594  */
00595 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00596 {
00597     reg ^= SWIZZLE_16;
00598     cvmx_write64_int16(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(1, reg), value);
00599 }
00600 
00601 /**
00602  * Perform an atomic 8 bit write
00603  *
00604  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00605  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00606  */
00607 static inline void cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00608 {
00609     reg ^= SWIZZLE_8;
00610     cvmx_write64_int8(__cvmx_hwfau_store_address(1, reg), value);
00611 }

00615  */
00616 extern int cvmx_fau64_alloc(int reserve);

00619  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00620  */
00621 extern int cvmx_fau32_alloc(int reserve);

00624  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00625  */
00626 extern int cvmx_fau16_alloc(int reserve);

00629  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00630  */
00631 extern int cvmx_fau8_alloc(int reserve);

00634  *  @param address Base address of register to release.
00635  *  @return 0 on success; -1 on failure
00636  */
00637 extern int cvmx_fau_free(int address);
